qas.question: When was the Treaty of Versailles signed?
How many square miles did the Treaty of Versailles add to the British Empire?
Which countries' colonies were given to the Allied powers in 1919?
What modern-day country is South-West Africa?
How many people did the Treaty of Versailles add to the British Empire?

context: Under the terms of the concluding Treaty of Versailles signed in <a0_0>1919<a0_0/>, the empire reached its greatest extent with the addition of <a1_0>1,800,000<a1_0/> square miles (4,700,000 km2) and <a4_0>13 million<a4_0/> new subjects. The colonies of <a2_0>Germany and the Ottoman Empire<a2_0/> were distributed to the Allied powers as League of Nations mandates. Britain gained control of Palestine, Transjordan, Iraq, parts of Cameroon and Togo, and Tanganyika. The Dominions themselves also acquired mandates of their own: the Union of South Africa gained South-West Africa (modern-day <a3_0>Namibia<a3_0/>), Australia gained German New Guinea, and New Zealand Western Samoa. Nauru was made a combined mandate of Britain and the two Pacific Dominions.
